snippet: Officials say the bones, which were found in 2005, are those of Jon-Niece Jones, whose sister told officials that their mother had killed her.
abstract: Investigators conclude that skeletal remains discovered in a wooded area of central New Jersey in 2005 are those of Jon-Niece Jones of Harlem, who they say was dumped in the area off by family members; Likisha Jones, James Jones and Godfrey Gibson have been charged with several counts of obstructing justice in connection with the disposal of the body.

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials say the bones, which were found in 2005, are those of Jon-Niece Jones, whose sister told officials that their mother had killed her.

headline.seo: New Jersey Remains Are Linked to Harlem Girl
headline.main: Remains Found in ’05 Are of Harlem Girl, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Remains Found in ’05 Are of Harlem Girl, Authorities Say
